summary: This is a July 5, 2020 internal update from the Public Corruption Unit summarizing significant developments in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It details Epstein's suicide, the ongoing investigation into co-conspirators, the indictment and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell, and efforts to interview Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case who committed suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's former girlfriend, indicted on June 29, 2020, for her role in grooming underage victims for sexual abuse by Epstein and participating in some abuse. Arrested on July 2, 2020, and detained pending trial.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The team is pursuing a potential interview with him regarding the case, but his counsel has not been cooperative for a voluntary interview.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presided over Ghislaine Maxwell's initial appearance and bail hearing on July 1, 2020, and granted the prosecution's request to detain her pending trial.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's former girlfriend who groomed multiple underage victims for sexual abuse by Epstein and participated in some of the abuse.
The document references one of Epstein's employees who worked with Maxwell in scheduling massages, setting up rooms, photographing victims, and paying victims.
The prosecution's pursuit of an interview with Prince Andrew implies a social or investigative connection to the Epstein case.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Indicted
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrested
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire.

events.title: Maxwell's Initial Appearance and Bail Hearing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell had an initial appearance and bail hearing before Judge Nathan, who ordered her detained pending trial.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial was scheduled for July 2021.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The investigation developed considerable evidence that Ghislaine Maxwell groomed multiple underage victims for sexual abuse by Epstein in the 1990s and participated in some abuse.
Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, arrested on July 2, 2020, and detained pending a trial scheduled for July 2021.
Prosecutors were actively pursuing an interview with Prince Andrew, but his counsel was not cooperating for a voluntary interview, leading to considerations of a compelled interview under the MLAT.
The document references an unnamed employee of Epstein who assisted in scheduling massages, setting up rooms, photographing victims, and paying victims in the early to mid-2000s.
